content: It is hereby understood and agreed that the Hire Purchase Owners named in the Schedule (hereinafter referred to as the Owners) are the owners of the Insured Vehicle and the Insured Vehicle is the subject of a Hire Purchase Agreement made between the Owners of the one part and the Policyholder of the other part. It is further understood and agreed that any payment made in respect of loss or damage (which loss or damage is not made good by repair reinstatement or replacement) under Section I of this Policy shall be made to the Owners as long as they are owners of the Insured Vehicle and their receipt shall be a full and final discharge to the Company in respect of such loss or damage. It is also understood and agreed that notwithstanding any provision in the Hire Purchase Agreement to the contrary this Policy is issued to the Policyholder as the principal party and not as agent or trustee for the Owners and nothing herein shall be construed as constituting the Policyholder an agent or
questions: Who are considered the owners of the insured vehicle according to the document?
What is the relationship between the Hire Purchase Owners and the Policyholder?
Under what section of the policy will payments for loss or damage be made?
To whom will payments for loss or damage to the insured vehicle be made?
What conditions must be met for the Hire Purchase Owners to receive payment for loss or damage?
What does the receipt from the Owners signify in the context of the insurance policy?
Is the Policyholder considered an agent or trustee for the Owners under this policy?
How does the insurance policy treat provisions in the Hire Purchase Agreement that contradict the policy terms?
What role does the Policyholder play in the insurance policy?
Does the insurance policy allow for repair, reinstatement, or replacement in case of loss or damage?
